meanings.definition: The male head of a household.
meanings.sent1: The housefather always made sure everyone in the family was taken care of.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather was the housefather in our home, providing guidance and support to all of us.
meanings.sent3: The housefather decided it was time for a family game night, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: As the housefather, he was the sturdy oak tree that sheltered his family from life's storms.
meanings.sent5: The housefather's presence in the home was like a warm hearth on a cold winter's night.

meanings.definition: To act as the father figure in a household.
meanings.sent1: He would housefather the children while their parents were away, ensuring they felt safe and loved.
meanings.sent2: After his father passed away, he had to step up and housefather his younger siblings.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to think it was his job to housefather the new kitten, following it around protectively.
meanings.sent4: She housefathered the group of friends, always offering advice and support when needed.
meanings.sent5: In times of crisis, he would instinctively housefather those around him, providing comfort and reassurance.
